name: Hycodan

indications.text: hycodan indicated symptomatic relief cough adult patients 18 years age older .

contraindications.text: adults 18 years age older : one ( 1 ) tablet 5 ml oral solution every 4 6 hours needed ; exceed six ( 6 ) tablets 30 ml 24 hours . ( 2.2 ) measure hycodan oral solution accurate milliliter measuring device . ( 2.1 , 5.5 ) increase dose dosing frequency . ( 2.1 ) prescribe shortest duration consistent treatment goals . ( 2.3 ) reevaluate patients unresponsive cough 5 days sooner possible underlying pathology . ( 2.3 ) reevaluate patient prior refilling . ( 2.3 )

warningsAndPrecautions: hycodan supplied white-colored , biconvex tablet , one face bisected debossed `` 205 `` , face plain , available : ndc 64950-205-03 bottles 30 ndc 64950-205-10 bottles 100 store tablets controlled room temperature 20°c 25°c ( 68°f 77°f ) [ usp controlled room temperature ] . dispense tight , light–resistant container , defined usp , child-resistant closure . hycodan available clear red-colored , cherry-flavored oral solution : ndc 64950-342-05 : unit dose cup 5 ml ndc 64950-342-45 : case contains 40 unit dose cups 5 ml ( ndc 64950-342-05 ) , packaged 4 trays 10 unit dose cups ndc 64950-342-47 : bottle 473 ml
adverseReactions: hycodan contraindicated : pediatric patients younger 6 years age [ ( 5.2 , 5.3 ) , ( 8.4 ) ] . significant respiratory depression [ ( 5.2 ) ] . acute severe bronchial asthma unmonitored setting absence resuscitative equipment [ ( 5.4 ) ] . known suspected gastrointestinal obstruction , including paralytic ileus [ ( 5.9 ) ] . hypersensitivity hydrocodone , homatropine , inactive ingredients hycodan [ ( 6 ) ] .
indications_original: HYCODAN is indicated for the symptomatic relief of cough in adult patients 18 years of age and older.
contraindications_original: Adults 18 years of age and older : One (1) tablet or 5 mL of the oral solution every 4 to 6 hours as needed; not to exceed six (6) tablets or 30 mL in 24 hours. ( 2.2 ) Measure HYCODAN oral solution with an accurate milliliter measuring device. ( 2.1 , 5.5 ) Do not increase the dose or dosing frequency. ( 2.1 ) Prescribe for the shortest duration consistent with treatment goals. ( 2.3 ) Reevaluate patients with unresponsive cough in 5 days or sooner for possible underlying pathology. ( 2.3 ) Reevaluate patient prior to refilling. ( 2.3 )
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
HYCODAN is supplied as a white-colored, biconvex tablet, one face bisected and debossed with "205", and the other face plain, available in:
                  
                     
                     
                     
                     
                        
                           
                           NDC 64950-205-03
                           Bottles of 30
                        
                        
                           
                           NDC 64950-205-10
                           Bottles of 100
                        
                     
                  
                  Store tablets at controlled room temperature 20°C to 25°C (68°F to 77°F) [See USP Controlled Room Temperature]. Dispense in a tight, light–resistant container, as defined in the USP, with a child-resistant closure.
                  HYCODAN is available as a clear red-colored, cherry-flavored oral solution in:
                  
                     
                         NDC 64950-342-05: Unit Dose Cup of 5 mL
                     
                         NDC 64950-342-45: Case contains 40 unit dose cups of 5 mL (NDC 64950-342-05), packaged in 4 trays of 10 unit dose cups each
                     
                         NDC 64950-342-47: Bottle of 473 mL
adverseReactions_original:
HYCODAN is contraindicated for:
                  
                     All pediatric patients younger than 6 years of age [see Warnings and Precautions (5.2, 5.3), Use in Specific Populations (8.4)].
                     Significant respiratory depression [see Warnings and Precautions (5.2)].
                     Acute or severe bronchial asthma in an unmonitored setting or in the absence of resuscitative equipment [see Warnings and Precautions (5.4)].
                     Known or suspected gastrointestinal obstruction, including paralytic ileus [see Warnings and Precautions (5.9)].
                     Hypersensitivity to hydrocodone, homatropine, or any of the inactive ingredients in HYCODAN [see Adverse Reactions (6)].
